thread.section_title: Commodities Market News - Yahoo!7 Australia Finance
thread.title: $A higher, as sharemarkets rally

title: $A higher, as sharemarkets rally
text:
Fri, Aug 28, 2015, 5:42 PM AEST - Australia Markets closed $A higher, as sharemarkets rally AAP â€“ 12 minutes ago Print 
The Australian dollar is higher as optimism returns and commodities and sharemarkets rally. 
At 1700 AEST on Friday, the local unit was trading at 71.67 US cents, up from 71.13 cents on Thursday. 
The local share market rose 0.6 per cent and Asian share markets rallied, the highlight being Shanghai with an over four per cent gain, in stark contrast to the steep falls suffered earlier in the week. 
St George chief economist Hans Kunnen said firmer commodity prices helped the Australian dollar lift off its recent lows. 
"The Australian dollar has the potential to edge higher against the US dollar if commodity prices pick up and if the US refrains from hiking rates in September," he said. 
Mr Kunnen said strong US data that showed the American economy grew 3.7 per cent in the June quarter helped boost oil prices and commodity currencies such as the Australian dollar. 
The focus for local investors will be on Tuesday's Reserve Bank interest rate announcement and Wednesday's June quarter economic growth figures. 
The RBA is expected to keep the cash rate unchanged but the focus will be on if recent stock market turmoil has changed its thinking on the likelihood of future rate moves. 
CURRENCY SNAPSHOT AT 1700 AEST ON FRIDAY 
One Australian dollar buys: 
* 71.67 US cents, from 71.13 cents on Thursday 
* 86.75 Japanese yen, from 85.55 yen 
* 63.61 euro cents, from 62.78 euro cents 
* 110.84 New Zealand cents, from 110.36 NZ cents 
* 46.49 British pence, from 45.92 pence 
(*Currency closes taken at 1700 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
